no.ovitas.compass2.kb.store.service.impl
Class GenericManagerImpl<T,PK extends Serializable>

java.lang.Object
  no.ovitas.compass2.kb.store.service.impl.GenericManagerImpl<T,PK>
Type Parameters:
T - a type variable
PK - the primary key for that type
All Implemented Interfaces:
GenericManager<T,PK>
Direct Known Subclasses:
DirectRelationManagerImpl, DirectRelationTypeManagerImpl, KnowledgeBaseDaoManagerImpl, ScopeManagerImpl, TopicManagerImpl, TopicNameManagerImpl
public class GenericManagerImpl<T,PK extends Serializable>
extends Object
implements GenericManager<T,PK>

This class serves as the Base class for all other Managers - namely to hold common CRUD methods that they might all use. You should only need to extend this class when your require custom CRUD logic.

To register this class in your Spring context file, use the following XML. 

     <bean id="userManager" class="no.ovitas.compass2.kb.store.service.impl.GenericManagerImpl">
         <constructor-arg>
             <bean class="no.ovitas.compass2.kb.store.dao.hibernate.GenericDaoHibernate">
                 <constructor-arg value="no.ovitas.compass2.kb.store.model.User"/>
                 <property name="sessionFactory" ref="sessionFactory"/>
             </bean>
         </constructor-arg>
     </bean>

If you're using iBATIS instead of Hibernate, use: 

     <bean id="userManager" class="no.ovitas.compass2.kb.store.service.impl.GenericManagerImpl">
         <constructor-arg>
             <bean class="no.ovitas.compass2.kb.store.dao.ibatis.GenericDaoiBatis">
                 <constructor-arg value="no.ovitas.compass2.kb.store.model.User"/>
                 <property name="dataSource" ref="dataSource"/>
                 <property name="sqlMapClient" ref="sqlMapClient"/>
             </bean>
         </constructor-arg>
     </bean>

Author:
Matt Raible
